block.p: Robin Beth Epstein, the daughter of Arlene and George Epstein of Port Washington, N.Y., is to be married today to William David Samers, a son of Edith Samers of Stamford, Conn., and the late Bernard Samers. Rabbi Jeffrey Salkin is to perform the ceremony at the North Hills Country Club in Manhasset, N.Y.

The bride, 27, is a public affairs associate in New York for the Committee for Economic Development, a public policy research organization. She graduated from Lehigh University. Her father is an electrical engineering consultant. Her mother teaches nursery school at the Community Synagogue in Port Washington.

The bride, 27, is a public affairs associate in New York for the Committee for Economic Development, a public policy research organization. She graduated from Lehigh University. Her father is an electrical engineering consultant. Her mother teaches nursery school at the Community Synagogue in Port Washington.

The bridegroom, 32, works in New York as the assistant director of planned giving for the American Committee for the Weizmann Institute of Science in Rehovot, Israel. He graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and received a law degree from Boston University. His mother is the executive director of the United Jewish Federation of Stamford. His father was the executive vice president of the American Committee for the Weizmann Institute.
